post:
[<strong>...</strong>](http://ellipsisno.de/) hosts unmanaged virtual private servers out of OVH (Montreal) and Fiberhub (Vegas). I'm out of stock at the latter and have just finished configuring a new node at the former. If you've been tentatively interested in a MTL location, now's your chance for a fresh start. The following plans are exclusive to readers of LET.

<pre><a href="http://ellipsisno.de/let/#new"><strong>ISOLATIONISM</strong></a>  
2 TB BW  
22 GB HDD  
222 MB RAM  
222 MB VSwap  
222 IPv6  
$2.22 / 22 days  
$12.22 / year

<a href="http://ellipsisno.de/let/#new"><strong>SOCIOLOGY OF KNOWLEDGE</strong></a>  
3 TB BW

333 IPv6

$13.33 / year

<a href="http://ellipsisno.de/let/#new"><strong>TWO-PLACE OPERATION</strong></a>  
9 TB BW

$9.99 / 99 days  
$19.99 / year</pre>

<strong>Specs</strong> Intel Xeon E5-1650 & E5-1620 processors, RAID 1 HDD, <a href="http://www.ovh.com/ca/en/anti-ddos/"><strong>DDoS protection</strong></a>, OpenVZ, SolusVM and lots of OS to choose from. VPS come with 3 cores by default. If you'd like more, I can add them at no extra cost. Test IP = 192.99.39.45.

<strong>TUN/TAP</strong> can be toggled from SolusVM.

<strong>Extra IPs</strong> are $12 / year / IP.

<strong>Is X allowed?</strong> No mass mailing please. Don't really care otherwise, as long as you're not crippling the node. From the terms: "VPS may not exceed a 15 minute load average greater than two times the amount of provisioned CPU cores." I'm not very strict about this so don't worry if the load spikes thrice in a blue moon or whatever.

<strong>Will you accept a different payment gateway?</strong> I'm working on a Payoneer account right now. If you'd prefer a certain gateway, let me know and I'll see what I can do.

<strong>Payments</strong> are accepted via PayPal and BitPay with a <a href="http://ellipsisno.de/terms/"><strong>7 day money back guarantee</a>. Thanks for your interest.
